name: Football Potpourri Trivia Game | NFL Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which was the last team in 2008 to go undefeated?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee Titans.

	The Titans lasted all the way to Week 12 with a 10-0 record.  In Week 12, they met Brett Favre and the New Jets, who put the Titans in their place 34-13.  By the end of Week 12, the Giants were also 10-1 but lost in Week 6 to the Browns, 35-14.

questions.text: Which non-quarterback was the first to throw more than 10 touchdown passes in his career?
questions.explanation:
Frank Gifford.

	Both Allen and Byars threw six touchdowns in their careers, and Harper didn't throw any.  Gifford was a halfback and flanker for 12 seasons with the New York Giants from 1952-1964.  In addition to rushing for 34 touchdowns, receiving another 43, Frank threw 14 touchdown passes of his own.  Gifford was a 1977 Hall of Fame inductee.

questions.text: Which NFL team was the first to go win-less in an entire season while losing at least 10 games?
questions.explanation:
Detroit Lions.

	In 1942, the Lions went a miserable 0-11 in the season.  They were shutout in the season five times, including a 42-0 blowout against the Bears.  In those 11 games, the Lions had only five touchdowns in the season offensively.  They also threw 33 interceptions.  The team's leading rusher was Mickey Sanzotta, who rushed for only 268 yards for the season.

questions.text: In a Super Bowl XXIV blowout, the San Francisco 49ers embarrassed their opponents 55-10.  Which team was on the losing end?
questions.explanation:
Denver Broncos.

	In Super Bowl XXIV, 49er quarterback Joe Montana threw five touchdown passes, three of which were pulled in by Jerry Rice.  Brent Jones and John Taylor caught the other two.  Tom Rathman ran for two touchdowns while Roger Craig had one.  San Francisco had the Broncos where they wanted them by halftime, 27-3.

questions.text: The New England Patriots went a perfect 16-0 in the regular season in 2007.  They were the first team to go undefeated since the 1972 Dolphins did it by going 14-0.  Prior to the Dolphins, there was another professional team that went undefeated in a season, and also won 29 straight games that covered three seasons.  Which team was it?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland Browns.

	The Browns were a part of the AAFC from 1946-1949 before becoming a part of the NFL.  In midseason 1947, the streak began until October 1949.  Sandwiched in-between was their 14-0 perfect season in 1948.

questions.text: In 1970, New Orleans kicker Tom Dempsey kicked an amazing 63-yard field against the Lions in a game.  That record was tied in 1998 by the Broncos' Jason Elam.  In the 2006 season, the record was almost tied twice.  Matt Bryant of the Buccaneers kicked a 62-yard bomb against the Eagles.  Who else kicked a 62-yarder five weeks later in 2006?
questions.explanation:
Rob Bironas.

	The Titans' Rob Bironas booted the big one against the Colts in Week 13.  The Titans would win that game 20-17.

questions.text: Which of the following USA sports stars was inducted into the NFL Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation:
Lenny Moore.

	Moore was a career Baltimore Colt from 1956-1967.  He was a halfback/flanker by trade, and made them both count.  Four times he led the league in rushing yardage per average, and rushed for 63 touchdowns.  From the air, Lenny averaged 16.6 yards per catch during his entire career, while hauling in 363 passes along with 48 of those for a touchdown.  He was inducted into the Hall of Fame in 1975.  Nowitzki was a NBA great, and Wallace was a 1953 MLB Hall of Fame inductee.  Holman was a Professional Bowlers Association (PBA) Hall of Fame inductee.

questions.text: Which team in 1988 set a record by getting 39 first downs in one game?
questions.explanation:
New York Jets.

	In Week 13 of the season, the Jets defeated the Dolphins 38-34.  While the Dolphins and Dan Marino threw for 353 yards with five touchdowns, the Jets, behind the arms of Pat Ryan and Ken O'Brien threw for 433 yards with four touchdowns.  The game-winner was an 18-yard pass from O'Brien to Wesley Walker.

questions.text: Multi-position player Red Grange played in the NFL during the 1920s and 1930s.  This Hall of Fame great was also nicknamed "The Galloping Ghost" because of his running style.  What was Grange's first name?
questions.explanation:
Harold.

	Harold Edward Grange played in eight seasons.  In seven of those he played on both offense and defense as a Chicago Bear, and one season as a New York Yankee.  A halfback by trade, he scored 21 rushing touchdowns, caught 10 from the air, and also threw another 10.  He was inducted into the hall in 1963.

questions.text: In 2007, Patriots wide receiver Randy Moss set a new season record for hauling in 23 touchdown passes in the season.  Whose record did he break?
questions.explanation:
Jerry Rice.

	Rice caught 22 TD passes during the 1987 season, in front of the arms of Joe Montana and Steve Young.  Rice set that record while breaking the record of 18 set by Mark Clayton of the Dolphins in 1984.  Clayton's touchdowns were compliments of quarterback Dan Marino.
